alert.note: Alert for Ruby Mountains and East Humboldt Range; Southeastern Elko County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 4:44PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Elko County through 515 PM PDT... At 444 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles north of Currie to 14 miles southeast of Ruby Valley. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Heavy rainfall along with gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Elko County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM PDT for northeastern Nevada.

area.areaDesc: Ruby Mountains and East Humboldt Range; Southeastern Elko County
